intro: Doryopteris pedatifida, commonly known as the broad-leafed water fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its large, pinnately compound leaves that are often broad and slightly lobed. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its fronds are usually dark green and can reach lengths of up to 1 meter. Doryopteris pedatifida is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in aquatic or semi-aquatic conditions.
